Package me.lucyy.common.command

Interface Subcommand

All Known Implementing Classes:
HelpSubcommand, VersionSubcommand
public interface Subcommand
A subcommand.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean execute​(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender, org.bukkit.command.CommandSender target, java.lang.String[] args)
    Execute the command.
    java.lang.String getDescription()
    Get the description of the subcommand.
    java.lang.String getName()
    Gets the name of the subcommand.
    java.lang.String getPermission()
    Gets the permission needed to execute this subcommand
    java.lang.String getUsage()
    Gets the usage string for this subcommand.
    default java.util.List<java.lang.String> tabComplete​(java.lang.String[] args)
    Tab-complete this command.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name of the subcommand. Must not contain spaces.

    • getDescription

      java.lang.String getDescription()
      Get the description of the subcommand. This will be shown to the user in help commands,

    • getUsage

      java.lang.String getUsage()
      Gets the usage string for this subcommand.

    • getPermission

      java.lang.String getPermission()
      Gets the permission needed to execute this subcommand
      Returns:
      the permission, or null if no permission is needed

    • execute

      boolean execute​(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender, org.bukkit.command.CommandSender target, java.lang.String[] args)
      Execute the command.
      Parameters:
      sender - The player to run the command as.
      target - The player to act against. Note that this is different from the sender when, for example, the /pronouns sudo command is executed.
      args - The arguments.
      Returns:
      true if the command is syntactically correct; false if not (this will print the getUsage() message)

    • tabComplete

      default java.util.List<java.lang.String> tabComplete​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Tab-complete this command.
      Parameters:
      args - the command's arguments so far.
      Returns:
      a string list of potential options
